title: Dialogflow - Prebuilt playbook agents overview
abstract:
# Dialogflow - Prebuilt playbook agents overview
**Note:** This feature has limited access. Contact your Google Cloud account team to request access for this feature and to access the API reference documentation.
Prebuilt playbook agents are a collection of ready to use agents for common tasks and scenarios. They can be used to accelerate development for new agents.
For agents that require integrations with external services, you need to modify the configuration of the [tools](/dialogflow/vertex/docs/concept/tools) to integrate with the proper endpoints.
The following prebuilt playbook agents are available:
- [Department of Motor Vehicles (DMV)](/dialogflow/vertex/docs/concept/prebuilt-agent/department-of-motor-vehicles) 
- [Retail](/dialogflow/vertex/docs/concept/prebuilt-agent/retail) 
- [Travel](/dialogflow/vertex/docs/concept/prebuilt-agent/travel)
content:
## Import a prebuilt playbook agent
To import a prebuilt playbook agent to your project:
- If you have not already, follow the Dialogflow CX [setup](/dialogflow/cx/docs/quick/setup) instructions.
- Go to the console page: [Vertex AI Conversation console](https://console.cloud.google.com/gen-app-builder/) 
- Select your project from the console drop-down.
- If you have not already activated the API, read and agree to the Terms of Service, then click **Continue and activatethe API** .
- Click **Create a New App** or **New App** .
- Select **Generative playbook** .
- Provide a name for your generative agent.
- Click the **Prebuilts** icon in the left navigation menu.
- Click the agent of interest and click **Import as agent** .
- Edit the display name, select a location for the agent, and click **Create** .
- Refer to each agent-specific documentation to determine whether additional setup for integrations is needed.
- Start testing and customizing.
- Go to the [Dialogflow CX Console](https://dialogflow.cloud.google.com/cx/projects) .
- Choose your Google Cloud project.
- Select your agent or [create a new agent](/dialogflow/cx/docs/concept/agent#create) .
- Click the **Shared resources** from the left menu.
- Click **Prebuilt** in the Templates section.
- Click the **Agents** tab.
- Click the agent of interest and click **Import as agent** 
- Edit the display name, select a location for the agent, and click **Create** .
- Refer to each agent-specific documentation to determine whether additional setup for integrations is needed.
- Start testing and customizing.## Customizations and settings
To customize the agent and improve settings:
- Edit the [playbook agents](/dialogflow/vertex/docs/concept/agents) in the imported agent to meet your business needs.
- [Test the agent](/dialogflow/cx/docs/concept/console#simulator) using the simulator.
- To test your agent over chat, it is recommended to use [Dialogflow Messenger](/dialogflow/cx/docs/concept/integration/dialogflow-messenger) .
